attributes.action: Parliamentary Candidates must have lived in the seat for 2 years before standing
attributes.background: I find it undemocratic that Parliamentary Candidates can stand with no history or knowledge whatsoever of the seat, whereas you must be on the Electoral roll or live in the ward for local elections.
attributes.additional_details:
Here in North Dorset we had a very able local hopeful for the Tories, however the candidate selected was from the PM;s home town of Witney, having stood in the previous election in Cardiff.
This is the Westminster bubble in action.

attributes.action: Make employers offer bereavement leave following the death of a pet
attributes.background: The loss of a pet is a traumatic experience with research showing that the death of a companion animal is "just as devastating as the loss of a human significant other" (Planchon et al, 2002: 94). Yet Employment rights do not currently recognise the loss of a pet in terms of bereavement leave.
attributes.additional_details: Academic studies repeatedly show that companion animal guardians (pet owners) consider their companion animals as family members (Voith, 1985). Consequently the grief following a pet's death carries the same psychological and physical problems that occur when a significant human dies (Gerwolls & Labott, 1994). Employment rights recognise the need for a period of bereavement leave following the death of a human dependent but no formalised equivalent is afforded following the loss of a pet.

attributes.action: NHS England to fund second stem cell transplants for all conditions
attributes.background:
In July 2016 it was announced that second stem cell transplants would not be routinely funded by NHS England. Around 74% of patients achieved complete remission after second transplant.

We must get this decision to be overturned to give people the second chance that they deserve
attributes.additional_details:
My farther was diagnosed with Myelofibrosis in 2013 at the age of 46! He had a stem cell transplant at the beginning of 2014, from stem cell donation from his brother. Unfortunately at the end of 2016 we where told that my farther had a relapse, the bone marrow transplant had not been success. Myelofibrosis is a serious bone marrow disorder that disrupts your body's normal production of blood cells.

http://blog.anthonynolan.org/2016/09/nhs-england-and-second-transplants-our-statement/

attributes.action: Amend prior approval for phone masts to include a minimum distance from houses
attributes.background: There is currently no minimum distance stipulated for masts. They are cautious not to site masts next to playgrounds and schools but are happy to site them next to residential gardens with established play areas. Neighbours should actually be consulted prior to the submission of an application.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous examples across the country of mobile phone companies exploiting the relaxed planning rules by trying to site masts within so called 'breaks in the residential nature of the search area'. If the LPA does not refuse or grant an application for prior approval within 56 days its prior approval is automatically deemed to have been given and the mast can be built even if it is within a few metres of a residential property. The process needs to be far more transparent.

attributes.action: Do not allow MP's  to veto the democratic vote  to leave the European Union.
attributes.background: The people of the U.K. By a majority voted to leave the European Union on June 23rd 2016 but some MP's believe that it is their right to ignore the electorate who made this decision. Therefore we the undersigned call on the government not allow a vote on this decision.
attributes.additional_details: In refusing the opportunity for MP's to be given this vote it must remembered that Government gave a commitment to referendum which it stood by and the electorate with a turnout of more than 70% voted to leave the EU. Therefore Brexit must mean Brexit.

attributes.action: Increase funding on nursing homes to lower the cost of carehomes for families.
attributes.background: We visited a nursing home and were disheartened by the patients' solitude. Our hearts were torn by watching the elderly in care being so fragile and frail, armed with the knowledge that they receive such little funding. So we have started a campaign in conjunction with this

attributes.action: The NHS have to provide scanning machines for people who are obese .
attributes.background: I have just recently lost my son who was obese. On arrival at the hospital it was imperative that he had a scan but was unable to get 1 and apparently no where round about had 1that was suitable for his weight  .

attributes.action: Change the way Statutory Redundancy Payments are calculated please
attributes.background:
The current SRP is calculated by using your present salary only and this needs to change.  Working people that previously held full time roles within their company cannot use these years at the higher salary rate to calculate their final payment.  
A fair adjustment mechanism needs to be created.
attributes.additional_details:
Mum works part time for the last five years after giving birth but, had previously worked full time in the same role for ten years.  
The company decides to restructure and her role is made redundant.
Mum can only claim 15 years service at the part time salary.  
Result, greatly reduced final payment.
The full time salary should be used to calculate the 10 years working full time hours and part time salary to calculate the remaining 5 years.
Result, fair SRP using company records.

attributes.action: BRING BACK THE NIT NURSE
attributes.background: We all know that the little critters are at large within schools. But they have got significantly worse over recent years. Bringing back the nit nurse would give those parents who don't regularly check their children's hair the extra push they need.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair on all children involved. I myself have had to treat my daughter 3 times in the 2 weeks she's been back at school. This is almost abuse. Let's help all people involved.

attributes.action: Restart Flights to Sharm El Shiekh
attributes.background: Back in October 2015, a Russian flight crashed in Sinai with a suspicion of bombing.After that, many countries had suspended their flights to Sharm El Sheikh.This action has led to many consequences to Egypt's Tourism industry. The Egyptian government had already adopted new security measures.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.cairoscene.com/BusinessAndPolitics/Egypt-to-Install-Biometric-Equipment-to-Bolster-Airport-Security

http://egyptianstreets.com/2017/01/12/egypt-introduces-new-security-measures-for-everyone-travelling-to-south-sinai/

http://egyptianstreets.com/2016/09/28/egypts-tourist-numbers-drop-51-2-in-first-half-of-2016-capmas/

attributes.action: Fund the promise: Priority NHS treatment for War Pension attributable injuries
attributes.background: Successive Governments have promised since 1948, that War Pensioners would receive priority treatment for attributable injuries caused by their Military Service. In 2008 The Govt issued guidelines to receive priority treatment. This promise, a duty of care, to Military Personnel must be upheld.
attributes.additional_details: In 2008 The Government issued guidelines stating that:  If you are in receipt of a war pension award, be it a gratuity (one off payment) or a weekly pension, you are entitled under an NHS Executive Guideline HSG(97)31 to receive priority treatment for the accepted conditions on your war pension. Also, in 2008, this guideline was extended to include conditions that are not accepted under your war pension but could be caused from your service in the Armed forces.  The NHS does not honour this.

attributes.action: Close hospitality establishments over the Christmas period.
attributes.background: Christmas is a family time, hospitality workers work extremely hard during the Christmas run up and many don't get Christmas day off, nevermind boxing day. Some things are needed over the festive period; eating out isn't one of them.
attributes.additional_details: As a chef, it is expected that I will work over the festive period, including Christmas day, boxing day and all bank holidays, with no extra incentive.   I fully support retail workers having Christmas day AND Boxing day off, but this should be extended to those who work in hospitality too. This is especially important for those who work away from their hometowns, as one day off is not long enough to get home to see their family and means a Christmas day spent alone.

attributes.action: End the 'Special Relationship' with the USA in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: After 580,000 petitioned to ban his entry into the UK, Trump may become president. Our Special Relationship means the British people may be dragged into economic, political and military conflict by a hated man. In this time of vulnerability, the UK must distance itself from Trump's America.
attributes.additional_details: In a campaign mired in racism, xenophobia, extremism, and sexual assault, Donald Trump has outlined plans which, due to the US/UK 'Special Relationship', may endanger British citizens and interests. This includes nuclear proliferation in Korea and Japan, the abandonment of NATO, forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall, ground troops in Syria, torture, opposition to China, and potential war with Iran and North Korea. If Trump wins, the UK must take a stand against his administration.

attributes.action: Public Debate and Referendum on Fracking (Shale Gas) in the UK
attributes.background:
Fracking is a controversial process to extract natural gas by fracturing surrounding rock and directly a high pressure mix to release the gas.

I ask for a referendum on whether fracking should be allowed in the UK at all.  Public opinion seems strongly against yet applications are being approved.
attributes.additional_details:
Fracking is once again in the media with the Government ruling that horizontal fracking can go ahead in Lancashire. It follows the approval of fracking at Kirby Misperton in May (although this is delayed to to legal challenges).

There is little consensus on the long term impacts on the area and the surrounding areas after fracking. Examples in the US have resulted in water contamination and air pollution causing headaches and nausea not to mention confirmation of causing earthquakes.

attributes.action: Work with major chains to ban non-recyclable coffee cups ending up in landfill
attributes.background: In the UK over 2.5 billion take-away coffee cups are placed in landfill every year. The public are wrongly led to believe that these cups are actually recyclable (i.e. through environment friendly logos on the packaging). This is a major issue resulting in huge amounts of waste
attributes.additional_details:
'A conservative estimate puts the number of paper cups handed out by coffee shops in the UK at 3bn, more than 8m a day. Yet, supposedly, fewer than one in 400 is being recycled'.

I propose that the Government actively works with major coffee chains and retailers to explore the use of environmentally friendly coffee cups. As part of this, non-recyclable cups should be banned or a tax placed on them to encourage the use of 'cups for life' and bringing in a national awareness of the problem.

attributes.action: Increase income tax by 1% and use it to boost NHS funding only.
attributes.background: We are aware that the NHS is facing difficult times.We are fortunate that is has fantastic infrastructure employing a wealth of skilled workers. The NHS directly benefits all of us. Even those with private health insurance employ staff relying on the NHS. We will all benefit from a strong NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
When we or our loved ones are sick, we need the support of the health service and we value the skill and commitment of staff. Nobody likes to wait for hours for appointments, test results or operations, but the service is under strain. The range of treatments is vast and the population is growing.
Every penny each of us puts into the NHS is a way of looking after ourselves and those we love.
Let's have an NHS to feel proud of. I am happy to have two less Starbucks a week to make this happen.

attributes.action: Introduce tax on disposable coffee cups to reduce waste
attributes.background:
2,500,000,000 disposable coffee cups are thrown away in the UK each year. 

1 in 400 are recycled. The coffee industry and chains are NOT doing enough voluntarily to reduce waste. The tax for plastic bags worked-use fell massively. Let's consider the environment and do the same with coffee cups.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to start reducing our waste now before it is too late.

100,000 trees are used for the cups each year: 
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/oct/05/uks-billions-of-takeaway-cups-could-each-take-30-years-to-break-down

Ministers reject coffee cup tax despite massive wastage: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/oct/31/ministers-reject-calls-for-charge-on-disposable-coffee-cups

Plastic bag reductions: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36917174

attributes.action: Allow GP's to be able to refer patients to out of area mental health services
attributes.background: With physical health you can request to be referred to a different hospital not in your borough through your GP. With mental health your GP can only refer you to the mental health services in your area. Patients should be able to request to go to specialised services through their GP for all health.
attributes.additional_details:
More patients are being referred back to their GP's and they can be the person who knows the patient best and need to have the option of sending the patient else where.

It could in certain situations help people get the help they need quicker if a GP can refer patients even if their service did refer them after being assessed onto somewhere that has wasted so much time and money that could've been saved if the GP and patient already knew where they needed to be referred to have the assessment.

attributes.action: Ensure every school in the UK has Bullying awareness lessons for ages 5-16
attributes.background: Bullying effects many peoples lives, touches many family's & interrupts the personal and academic growth of every child. Personally as a child back in 1993 i was affected by bullying that still makes a impact on my adulthood today. I just don't see any improvement since then to protect our children
attributes.additional_details:
This petition suggests some of the following:

Every school is required by education policy through DfE to have group discussions setting out a plan on how to help pupils report bullying, its effects and challenges throughout academic growth.

Requests each school in UK to have Bullying awareness lessons ages 5-16 at least 3 times a year.

attributes.action: Establish economic tests to assess readiness for Brexit.
attributes.background: The decision to leave the European Union will have huge consequences for the United Kingdom. The economic tests that were created to assess readiness for EMU provide a model for taking proper account of the economic consequences prior to notifying the EU of our intention to leave under Article 50.
attributes.additional_details: Various attempts have been made to estimate the cost to the UK of Brexit. Such an estimate has to take into account potential loss of trade, inward investment and joint R&D, as well as additional spending on the military, borders, redundancy and pensions, and bureaucracy. This is against the background of record debt (approx. 90% GDP). Parliament should establish metrics for the economic impact of each Brexit scenario (e.g. so-called hard or soft) so that an informed decision can be made.

attributes.action: Move parliament away from the Palace of Westminster to Carlisle, Cumbria
attributes.background: London-centric government leads to a distorted view of the UK and a disproportionate distribution of resource. The Northern Power House discussion mistakenly sees the Merseyside/Manchester/Leeds axis as the North of England. Government from Carlisle will shift more than just the base of politics.
attributes.additional_details: The problems of poor infrastructure, transport and communication can be ignored while the British Government continues to rule from Westminster. The North East has at least reasonable transport links; Cumbria boasts two lane trunk roads. Much of Cumbria has poor mobile signal and even poorer broadband.  What might change if the Government had to try to function in that environment.  This time Cumbria, after 10 years perhaps another northern county, then perhaps Cornwall!

attributes.action: Ban cold calling by businesses to mobile and home phones
attributes.background: Cold calling has always been a problem but recently it is becoming a real nuisance with companies ringing personal mobile/home phones at all times of day and night sometimes multiple times within a day to either sell products, force PPI claims or tell you you've been in an accident when you haven't.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies should not be able to obtain and call your personal phone often with wrong or assumptive information and of a repetitive nature, with some companies calling multiple times in the same week despite being told you are not interested which is harassment and against human rights.

I am petitioning to ban cold calling from businesses to home and mobile phones as to protect people from being harassed in their personal time as it can be very distressing in particular for vulnerable citizens.

attributes.action: Replace religious education in UK schools with a comparative history of religion
attributes.background: Religion can be the cause of social and educational schism.
attributes.additional_details: School is our first experience of institutional life and so, as a priority, it should be inclusive and harmonised from the outset. Religion is used in our schools as a context to teach ethics. A Comparative History of Religion will foster objectivity and tolerance, which are themselves virtuous. A Comparative History of Religion will produce an empirical lesson in social harmony that is psychologically wholesome, undeniable and therefore enduring.

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket.
attributes.background: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket with reflective strips at all time when on the road and no headphones. To help them to be seen by motorists and they can hear what is happening on the road. This is after truck and car drivers are getting blamed for deaths of cyclists.

attributes.action: Stop street beggars from using live animals to support their begging.
attributes.background:
All over London's West End tourist spots there are gangs of Eastern Europeans using dogs to aid their begging.
The dogs are dressed up in clothes, hats and sunglasses, and are made to to sit out in all weathers for hours to attract the public and encourage them to give money.

attributes.action: abolish hate crime laws in the UK
attributes.background: A crime is a crime. the motivation for committing the offence should be inconsequential to the sentencing. Labelling an offence as racially, religiously or gender motivated only serves to create an 'us and them' mentality.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months police have been silencing anti  Islam and anti  refugee opinions by labelling them as hate crimes. recently Nottinghamshire police have taken the law into their own hands and have made misogyny a hate crime (but not misandry). This has turned certain groups into protected classes in society.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for cinemas to provide access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.background:
1 in 6 people in the UK have some form of hearing loss or deafness, this accounts for 11 million people, with over 900,000 having a severe or profound deafness. 

Fewer than 1% of cinema screening are currently subtitled, we would like to see an increase in access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details:
On January 17th 2017, it becomes mandatory for all cinemas showing digital films within the United States of America to provide closed-caption personal subtitling devices at every showing. This means that open screen subtitling, which is infrequently programmed, isn't the only option for patrons with hearing loss. 

We believe that the UK should follow suit and provide proper access to those with hearing loss that wish to access the cinema.

attributes.action: Reduce the annual income for a spousal visa to be in line with living wage
attributes.background:
The spousal visa requirement means that I must be earning £18,600 a year (and increases with dependents) To even be consider for the visa means that most people cannot afford to be in love.
I myself work two well paid jobs and still don't meet the criteria. This means my husband cannot join me.
attributes.additional_details:
The visa requirement would be much fairer for all if it was in line with the living wage and would stop the separation of 43% of family's.

This requirement has been a problem for many families for a long time and something needs to change. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/feb/21/families-challenge-minimum-income-visa-rules-supreme-court-non-eu-partner 

There should not be a price to pay for being happy and in love.

attributes.action: Remove status from charities paying staff more than 3 times the average wage.
attributes.background: Charities in the UK should have their charitable status removed if they pay any of their staff more than three times the average wage. Why should a pensioner on less than £150 a week give £5 to a charity that pays a CEO £200k? In 2016-2017 three times the average wage is £82,500. Many get more.
attributes.additional_details: By way of examples - Parkinson's UK has 10 staff earning between £60,000 and £130,000, The Royal British Legion has 26 staff earning between £60,000 and £160,000, Help for Heroes has 17 staff earning between £60,000 and £110,000 and Cancer Research UK has 219 staff earning between £60,000 and £250,000.

attributes.action: Change the redundancy law around workers who were full time & are now part time.
attributes.background: The law is very clear, It is defined as this "it is your part-time position which is being made redundant, you are therefore being compensated for your current part-time position." This is regardless of any previous full-time service, even if that is 10+ yrs of dedication over 2 yrs of part-time.
attributes.additional_details: In my opinion, those who are affected by this are those that have had a family or are a dedicated caregiver. With years of unwavering service to their company & returning part time, how is it justifiable not to consider that service at a time when it is most needed. What if  the job specification never changed, what if you are supporting a full-time role on part-time hours, which is the majority of cases. Redundancy is based on a calculation, a formula, that formula can be adapted.

attributes.action: Urge India to allow UNHRC intervention in Kashmir
attributes.background: On 17/08/16, the UNHRC stated that it 'could only assume the worst' following the failure of the Indian authorities to grant its office access to Kashmir. Recently, thousands of civilians have been injured by armed forces during continuing protests across the region. Death toll now exceeds 60.
attributes.additional_details: Refusal to allow a UNHRC visit comes at a time when the Indian state stands accused of using disproportionate force to crush protests. To date, military-occupied Kashmir has seen over 70000 killings, 8000+ enforced disappearances & countless cases of torture & sexual violence. The Indian state has given impunity to its armed forces so as to protect them from prosecution for international crimes, including war crimes. The state stands in violation of its own laws as well as international laws.

attributes.action: Amend the  Dog Act to include taking DNA of every dog to be kept with Microchip.
attributes.background: Due to the high number of dog attacks the aim is to force all dog owners to have their dog DNA taken and  register it with the dog's microchip. This  would allow all dogs to be screened for banned breed DNA and if attacks take place wounds could be swabbed and aggressors traced.
attributes.additional_details:
If a dog is  already microchipped the addresses are known and the owners could be contacted and asked to get the DNA profile done.
The DNA would also help with tracing of owners of dogs who leave poo uncollected, which will help District Councils prosecute culprits.

attributes.action: Criminalise politicians and the media for lying, misleading or misinforming.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was the biggest decision in modern history. But the decision made was based on lies, misinformation and speculation. We need an independent body with the power to impose legal repercussions on politicians and media organisations for circulating misleading or untrue claims.
attributes.additional_details:
Gisela Stuart, Boris Johnson and Michael Gove said: 
"After we Vote Leave, there won’t be a sudden change that disrupts the economy." Yet the Brexit vote triggered the biggest fall in the pound in history.
Nigel Farage disowns Vote Leave '£350m for the NHS pledge' hours after EU referendum result. Also, the £350 million figure was deemed 'misleading' (UK Statistics Authority). 
The Sun published "The Queen backs Brexit" - Buckingham Palace complained to IPSO about this claim.

attributes.action: Elevate the Cotswolds area of outstanding natural beauty to national park status
attributes.background: The Cotswolds is already an area of outstanding natural beauty, but continues to be accosted by unsuitable development. By elevating it to become a national park, increased protections in planning law will defend its beauty for generations to come and provide a much needed Midlands national park.

attributes.action: Improve the social welfare safety net for people fleeing domestic abuse
attributes.background: Domestic abuse is a horrific situation for anyone to find themselves in & especially difficult for anyone who has to make decisions not just about their wellbeing but for children in their care. 2 women are killed weekly in the UK-if people feel they can leave safely this number may be reduced.
attributes.additional_details:
There is an alarming lack of support for people fleeing domestic abuse, especially women/families. This manifests the deprivation that families often experience moving out from an abuser or from a shelter.

"The threat of poverty is often described as being ‘among the most formidable'" barriers (NOWLDEF, 2002:1) from leaving toxic - in some cases deadly - situations with serious consequences. This hole in the social safety net is short-sighted in both its financial and societal implications.

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Petition to finally shut down Dogs4Us and eradicate all puppy farming.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is still rife in the country and as a result thousands of animals are inhumanely treated and forced to breed. Millions of families receive animals who are in poor health and have numerous defects. Sadly many of these animals come from organisations like Dogs4Us. Lets stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs4Us has been exposed by numerous reputable news outlets yet the suffering still continuous. Together we can stop this abuse and shut down places like dogs4us as well as banning the act of puppy farming once and for all.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to send in the Army to protect lorry Drivers in France.
attributes.background: Due to increase on attacks to lorry drivers in Calais France before someone gets killed or serious injury to send over troops to protect the drivers and their lorries also the cost to damaged or soiled goods and maybe the destruction of businesses.

attributes.action: Add gender-neutral name fields to the marriage certificate
attributes.background: This petition proposes that two gender-neutral name fields be added to  the marriage certificate, to replace the father-only field. This suggestion is to enable parity, irrespective of gender/sexual orientation.
attributes.additional_details: In answer to the previous petition that the mother's name be added to the marriage certificate, alongside the father's [https://www.change.org/p/mothers-names-should-be-on-marriage-certificates], the Home Office decided that it cannot agree to adding the mother's name, as that assumes couples have opposite-gender parents, and the idea is therefore exclusionary. Gender-neutral name fields is the obvious solution to this problem.

attributes.action: Make Stereotyping a compulsory subject in schools.
attributes.background: As part of a citizenship group. We believe Stereotyping is a significant topic that should be discussed as a school subject so that students can understand the causes and consequences of Stereotyping. We are a group of different ethnical and cultural backgrounds and have seen stereotyping.

attributes.action: Enforce tougher penalties for mobile phone use while driving.
attributes.background: While driving around the country with work, I witness far too many drivers all over the road because they are using their mobile phones, mainly in their hands, while driving. This is mostly texting or typing. The current fine and penalty points are far too low and the penalty must be higher.
attributes.additional_details:
Drivers who text on the road are in far more danger than intoxicated drivers.

A Techtimes study results show those who occupied themselves with text messages, either by reading or writing them, had slower reactions times by 35%. By comparison, drunk drivers displayed a 12% decrease in reaction time, while drivers intoxicated with cannabis had slowed response times by 21%. http://www.techtimes.com/articles/8185/20140609/texting-is-more-dangerous-than-drugs-alcohol-while-driving-study.htm

attributes.action: Stop the production of the 1 pence coins.
attributes.background:
The rate of inflation has made 1 pence coins virtually unusable. 
Canada has already removed its lowest value currency from circulation.
If the cost to produce one Canadian Penny is 1.5 Canadian Cents, then we can assume it has a similar cost in the UK.
It is uneconomical to keep in circulation.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/cost_to_produce_one_penny

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-21292441

attributes.action: Change the house buying process in England, Wales and NI
attributes.background: A petition to address the requirement of consumer protection when purchasing or selling a property. Minimising financial exposure and risk after price agreement and the subsequent common terms of sale changes; gazumping, gazundering and pulling out. MPs to create safeguards in earlier commitment.

attributes.action: Don't add the age verification and censoring of "non-conventional" on porn sites
attributes.background: Age verification checks on porn websites will be hard to implement. ISPs already offer many ways to do this without having to risk personal information. If age verification is done using credit card then dodgy websites may take advantage of this.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should not be allowed to decide what types of porn people are allowed to watch. As long as its consenting, over-18 adults, and it does not go against current law then it should be perfectly fine to show online.

Implementing age verification on to websites will be very risky if it uses personal information to check you are over-18. Lots of porn sites have been hacked recently so that is also a big concern. Parental controls can be easily setup so this is unneeded.

attributes.action: Fit seat belts on all public transport where there are seats provided.
attributes.background: Please would you consider fitting seat belts on all public transport where there are seats available, for the safety of the public. Cars, mini buses & cabs require this as law. Thank you.

attributes.action: Bring back Art History A Level
attributes.background: One of the main reasons I am now doing a degree in History of Art was because I studied it for A Level. This academic discipline explores and analyses the oldest form of human expression, older than literature, language and music. Without the chance to study it at school, the subject will disappear.

attributes.action: Implement Mandatory Licensing For Estate Agents
attributes.background:
How can an industry that deals with the most valuable asset that their customers own, not be regulated by licensing as other industries are?

Complaints against estate agents are up 32% with a record £800,000 being paid out in compensation to home buyers, sellers and tenants (Oct 2016, TPOS).
attributes.additional_details: https://www.tpos.co.uk/news-media-and-press-releases/reports

attributes.action: UK govt to strongly condemn India for genocide of innocent Kashmiri muslims
attributes.background: Kashmiri muslims are asking for their right of freedom, which was conferred to them according to UN resolutions. They want Their right of plebiscite. Indian army is killing innocent and unarmed Kashmiri Muslims. Killings should be stopped immediately and Kashmiri should be invited for dialogue.

attributes.action: A constitution that forbids our Parliament ceding sovereignty to foreign powers.
attributes.background: This would prevent governments gradually ceding sovereignty to foreign powers as they have done for example over the last 44 years to the EU treaty by treaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Tony Benn on the Lisbon treaty & the EU > https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GTjg-vt0Ao4

'If parliament transfers sovereignty away in treaties such as Lisbon then it is stealing rights that don't belong to it because an MP is lent powers of the public for 5 years

But if in those 5 years you give it away to somebody else then you can't repeal those laws. This is a theft of public rights.'

attributes.action: Make the North East Combined Authority give the people a vote on Devolution
attributes.background:
SUNDERLAND COUNCIL LEADER PAUL WATSON HAS TOLD THE NEWCASTLE CHRONICLE WE THE PUBLIC DON’T WANT A VOTE ON DEVOLUTION 
HE SEEMS TO HAVE FORGOTTEN WE HAVE ALREADY VOTED ON DEVOLUTION IN 2004 AND IT WAS A MASSIVE MAJORITY TO REJECT DEVOLUTION
